question: Do raspberries improve postprandial glucose and acute and chronic inflammation in adults with type 2 Diabetes?
ideal_answer: yes, raspberries improve postprandial glucose and acute and chronic inflammation in adults with type 2 Diabetes.

snippets.text: The NLR family pyrin domain containing 3 (NLRP3) inflammasome plays a critical role in insulin resistance and the pathogenesis of type 2 diabetes. Red raspberry (RB) contains high amounts of dietary fibers and polyphenolic compounds, which are known for their anti-oxidative and anti-inflammatory effects.
